leads.business_name: Optical Center | Kaiser Permanente Pleasanton Medical Offices

leads.worst_review_text: Worst optometry in east bay. I do not know where they order from, they commit two weeks, but prescription glasses come in more than 8-10 weeks. No communication and correspondence from staff on status update. People with insurance please go to any other optometry.

This review is not about the doctors, but specifically about my experience with one of the front desk assistants.

I called the office to ask about a prescription on behalf of a patient, fully understanding there are privacy rules and authorization requirements. However, the way this was handled by the assistant was extremely unprofessional. She was curt and dismissive, and at one point hung up on me. When I asked if she could hear me clearly, I was brushed off instead of being spoken to with basic courtesy.

I was not asking anyone to break rules—I was simply trying to understand the proper process, which could have been explained calmly and respectfully. Front office staff are often a patient’s first point of contact, and this interaction left a very negative impression of the practice, despite not being a reflection on the doctor’s medical care.

I hope the clinic takes this feedback seriously and provides training to ensure patients and their representatives are treated with professionalism and respect.

leads.business_name: Diamond Valley Optometry formerly William Diamond, OD

leads.worst_review_text: I took a 1 and a half hour train journey to London and my highlight was to be seeing a Bugatti from outside of the dealer. Imagine my disappointment ,then,when I found that the glass doors were opaque. Is that really necessary.

All i can say is that after buying the car, we took it at the mecanic to see if it’s all in order. Of course it wasn’t. Car is 6 years old so I expected to have some minor issues. Well it wasn’t the case. Most are major. Both front suspensions need urgent changing. Only that costs over £1200. Spent over £2k already to have it fixed as the 6 month warranty doesn’t cover nothing from those 5 issues that were found. I am really disappointed as i am sure they were aware of the issues. No dealership buys a car without having it checked first.

leads.worst_review_text: I made an appointment for an oil change. The day of, I waited two hours then checked on the status of my car. They hadn’t even started on it yet because one of their machines broke down. I told them that communication would have been nice because I would have left an hour ago. I understand that things happen and machines break, but communication would have been appreciated. I left with two hours wasted on my only day off and no oil change done. Super disappointed!

leads.address: 245 Lafayette St Suite 2, London, OH 43140, USA
leads.worst_review_text: The business with this dealership was excellent when I purchased the vehicle. But I have called and text Grant numerous times about a fin and brake light on the van I purchased. They was suppose put it on the van after a few days and now I am being ghosted. It has been atleast 3 weeks and no answer. I have even tried contacting the owner with no response. Do not leave the dealership without getting everything that he says he will provide.

leads.address: 2293 Dundas St, London, ON N5V 1R4, Canada
leads.worst_review_text: Having had an excellent experience when purchasing our vehicle from Empire, I've been very disappointed with their customer service since. We bought a warranty on the car with the dealership and every time I call and ask to speak to the service department about a problem, I am "put through" and there is no reply. The receptionist kindly takes my contact information...but nobody calls back. I do not usually post reviews to Google, but feel I have no other choice at this stage.

Untrustworthy Ali sold me a car with so much problems in September 2023. I took my car back to his 3months after my engine light appeared on the dash board. He could not help me. Within the 6months I had to go back 3 times regarding my car. To where now l've taken it to another garage for them to tell me there is a lot of problems with my car. I will not be purchasing another car from this dealership. They don't keep no records because apparently they have changed there name. You have changed your name because of how much of a botched job you do with the cars! You take advantage of women! When I came in with my partner it was a whole totally different situation.my car was full of different errors I took it to the garage and they said I was meant to have an engine light on however it was off, the last place I took my car was to the the mechanics on the site of the dealership. I paid them money to fix the problem only for them to just take my money and not fix the problem just cover it up by removing it from my dash board.

leads.address: 698 S Laurel Rd, London, KY 40744, USA
leads.worst_review_text: Don’t come here expecting to get much, the finance manager was extremely rude and demeaning. Quoted us an outrageous number without even doing the calculations through their system and laughed us out the door when we suggested it should be any lower. Needless to say we went to another dealer and got an almost identical truck for half of what he tried to quote

I like to believe most people are good and honorable, but I found neither at this dealership. It was a disappointing reminder of why I hadn’t purchased from a dealership in 8 years.

The car I chose had a sticker price of $23,777. After taxes and “document fees,” the salesman presented me a written quote of $26,267—the higher end of my $28,000 budget, but still manageable. Confident in the purchase, I even went ahead and bought insurance for the car.

That’s when the circus began. We arrived at 4:00 p.m. and were kept waiting for hours. Not called back until 7:45 p.m., nearly an hour after closing, exhausted and ready to sign. And that’s exactly what they were banking on.

When the finance manager finally slid the paperwork across the desk, my pen was literally on the page when I noticed the numbers. That $26,000 “deal”? Suddenly it had ballooned to over $30,000. No explanation. No disclosure. Just “sign here.”

And why? Because they had quietly tacked on thousands in worthless warranties and add-ons I never asked for. Things no one bothered to explain—just slipped in, hoping I’d be too tired or too trusting to notice. The only comments I heard were, “oh, we have a warranty on it” and “we’ll throw in the gap on us!” Throw in? No—sneak in.

When I called out this deceit, the manager insisted he’d given me a “great deal.” In what world does a $23,000 car magically becoming a $30,000 purchase qualify as a deal? To make matters worse, when I said no one told me the price increase, he brushed it off with, “I told you what the monthly payments would be.” As if anyone would assume a $26,000 quote somehow meant a $30,000 loan.

This dealership didn’t just lose a sale—they proved exactly why people hate buying cars. If you value your money, your sanity, and your dignity, stay far, far away.
Shame on you.

The worst and most stressful car buying experiences I’ve ever had.

Update: The car was finally returned but after much stress, dealing with unfriendly customer service and I wasn't fully compensated for my financial loss. They provided me the refund link with wrong details 4 times before I finally got my refund.

During the test drive, we noticed the car was pulling to the left. We immediately raised this with the salesperson, it was noted in the paperwork, and we were assured it would be fixed before collection. we even phoned Cargiant before pickup to double check, and they confirmed the issue had been resolved.

However, when we collected the car, it still had the exact same fault. Despite promising they would only release the car to customer once it was fixed and safe to drive, they knowingly handed us a faulty vehicle. The very next morning, we emailed them again to report the problem.

From there, aftercare has been appalling. When we reported the fault, we were told to take the car to KwikFit. However, when KwikFit tried to contact Cargiant for authorisation, their calls were not answered. We even had to phone Cargiant ourselves and hand the phone to the KwikFit mechanic, only for them to later confirm that they could not identify fault. We then tried four different garages, including the ones recommended by Cargiant and none were able to diagnose the issue.

When we asked Cargiant to handle the repair directly, the earliest appointment they offered was over a month away, and when we asked how long the repair would take, they did not give us an estimate. We also requested a courtesy car to cover the period without a vehicle, but this was refused. We then asked if they would cover our expenses for repeated drop-offs and pick-ups, which they also refused. Finally, we asked if they could collect and return the car themselves to save us further inconvenience, and again they refused.

Meanwhile, we rely on this car for work and daily needs. The amount of time, stress, and inconvenience this caused has been giant, all because Cargiant released a faulty and unsafe car instead of ensuring it was properly repaired.

As a last resort, we asked to return the vehicle. They gave us a appointment date two weeks later. When we went to drop it off yesterday, staff had no idea we were there to return the car, they thought we were booked in for fault inspection. We had to show them the email confirmation proving we were there to return the car.

Yesterday, we’ve dropped the car off and now waiting for their “internal inspection”. If they do not handle this fairly and promptly, we are prepared to take legal action and report them to the relevant authorities, including Trading Standards and The Motor Ombudsman.

We will keep this review updated. After this experience, We cannot recommend Cargiant. Once the sale is done, their support is dismissive, unhelpful, and completely fails to take accountability for selling a faulty car.

leads.address: 325 Mason St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

leads.worst_review_text: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE TODAY picking up my Rx refill. Young female at the ambulatory pharmacy window,  Skyler?,  was  clearly devoid of any customer service. Flat affect, and clear disinterest in dealing with customers today. Husband never had an issue with picking up my med for me but today I get the wrong person. I prepaid she it didn't show that I did so I paid again. She said my ID info wasn’t in the EMR so she had to re-enter my drivers license info in again? The medication requires cold packing, and has  always previously been done but not today. I asked for the cold packing and she responded “I’ll have to find someone to do that” while clearly annoyed. She then STILL placed my medication into a brown paper bag to give to me. I again, stated it needed to be cold packed at which time I asked for a manager. UF Health has had an unfavorable  reputation with regard to patient experiences and it appears work still needs to be done to improve in this area. I waited and a woman “Julie “ approached the window to speak to me. I asked if she was the manager but she stated she was the pharmacist for the day. Either the manager didn’t care to speak to me or they didn’t let him or her know there was a customer requesting them. I was not surprised and went on to relay my experience to Julie who listened but I must mention gave me the clear impression my complaint probably would go anywhere. I left but had to regrettably go back inside to get a receipt for my FSA records. The gentleman who provided my receipt was the same one who iced and gave me my medication earlier. I wish I had gotten his name because he was the only employee displaying any sense of an interaction in line with positive patient experiences. I have ALL my other prescriptions filled at a retail pharmacy but the one I picked up today regretably HAS to be filled at UF Health’s pharmacy due to their employee medical insurance plan. So sad patients have to deal with an employee who would be best replaced by a robot.

Waste of my time. It should not take this long. The worst sense of urgency for the Active Duty, the Retired, the families, the dependents and everyone in between. It should NOT take this long. Once again, waste of time.

leads.address: 6801 Roosevelt Blvd bldg 2050, Jacksonville, FL 32212, USA
leads.worst_review_text: If you have ANY alterative in getting your prescriptions, DO IT and don't utilize this pharmacy!  For the last 6 months, I have had to deal with continual grief in getting my prescriptions refilled and in getting new prescriptions filled.  Three months ago, I called the automated phone number for refills of my prescriptions to be picked up at the Satellite Pharmacy pick up window and was given a day when they would be available for pickup.  I went to the Satellite Pharmacy on that date, sat in my car for over 2 hours in line and once I got to the window, was informed they had one of the four prescriptions I called in, but didn't have the others.  I ended up going to the main hospital pharmacy to get the snafu fixed and my medications filled.  To activate new prescriptions, you have to go onto the Genesis patient portal, which is a nightmare in itself as you have to change your password every 60 days.  This normally would not be an issue, but you have to pick a password that doesn't utilize any of the same letters or characters used in the last 50 or so passwords used.  Anyway, I had managed to do this and indicated that I needed to activate my new prescriptions and wanted them sent to the Satellite Pharmacy pick up window, which was verified by the pharmacy technician via message on the Genesis patient portal.  Now today, I waited in my car in line for over 2 hours only to be told I had to go inside the building to pick up my medications via a pharmacy kiosk!  I went inside and then left after seeing a line of over 30 people waiting to pick up their medications!  If you try to speak to anybody about this they just give you a stupid look and tell you there isn't anything that can be done about it!  This is a travesty, as our active duty, veterans and their families deserve better treatment!  This is an example of socialized medicine at its worse!   There is no doubt that this is a government entity!  From now on, I will get my medications anywhere else and will gladly pay whatever I need to, as what time I have left here on this earth is not going to be spent on hours dealing with this ineptness!

leads.business_name: Normandin Chrysler Dodge Jeep Ram FIAT
leads.address: 900 Capitol Expressway Auto Mall, San Jose, CA 95136, USA
leads.worst_review_text: Horrible service. So disappointed do better Normandin. First they increased prices and wouldn’t tell me how much a basic oil change was over the phone. I had to wait to talk to my advisor so complete sticker shock when I dropped off my truck for an oil service. My vehicle was dropped off earlier than my schedule appointment and informed them I needed it back by a certain time (which was hours later)to be able to pick up my kids due to car seats. Advisor assured me it would be done by then. Never received a phone call or message informing me of my truck status. I finally was able to get ahold of someone in service who told me my truck would be done almost 2 hrs after I was told it would be done by a certain time. Advisor failed to inform me of this and I had to scramble to find someone to pick up my kids. Normandin you failed your customer and should have done more to retain your customer. having my vehicle is a safety for my kids & You should be ashamed of how you let down your customer.

Google reviews and stars has failed me on this. Thanks guys.
I came in for a first time visit and did not have a pleasant experience there. They were somewhat rude, except for the nice front desk blonde woman who found my insurance policy before arriving. I felt very unwelcomed there. The technician talked to me with her back facing me, speaking softly to where I couldn't understand her. Snapping bad images. Dr. was rushing and didn't allow me to ask her questions about contact options. I'm new to Austin so I have plenty of time to find a new permanent eye care service. Seems as they're probably selective with who they provide excellent service, or maybe I didn't fit their ideal typical patient, who knows. Lack of customer service is something I'll never accept. Maybe I'll try Yelp next time

My husband loves to buy flowers in there to support local business which is a great idea! leads.address: 3640 Stevens Creek Blvd, San Jose, CA 95117, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
Service department feels like a ripoff and totally inept. Initally dropped off my car for something which I thought was a warranty claim. Upon inspection, service department told me it was external damage and would be 600 for inspection. To be fair, it was external damage and not a warranty issue. After some back and forth (see text logs), I declined the repair. Suddenly it was only 590 for the entire fix due to them mis-reading the notes.
I had given them the benefit of doubt since this could be an honest mistake, however I had become cautious of their intent and wanted them to just not do the fix. I collected the car and I should have checked the car thoroughly at that point itself, but didn't since I didnt know where the fix was done.

After I got the car back, I noticed some glaring issues.
1. The front bumper was scratched near the place where they had opened it up. It looked like a machine made scratch.
2. The T30 bolts that were attaching the tub were  half screwed.
3. The plastic trim piece hiding the internals was broken.

I emailed this to the service director when I discovered, but there was no response.

I paid for the bumper scratch to be fixed out of my own pocket.

I will not be taking my car to them for any service or fixes in the future.

leads.address: 2295 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

leads.worst_review_text: The contact tech is absolutely amazing but…the contact lens’s dept is severely understaffed. One person fitting lenses on a Thursday with no one working at front desk. Every other area is fully staffed with employees everywhere yet this is what you get when you show up at 11:30 and again at 3:30
